CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, May 31, 1941, pg. 18 reads: "Young Nixon Dancer - John Robert Gibbs, son of Dr. and Mrs. E.H. Gibbs of 2171 Wylie Avenue, will be the only Negro in Mamie Barth's Revue, which will be shown at the Nixon Theater Wednesday, June 4. This downtown dancing school was the only one of six that would enroll Gibbs. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of John Robert Gibbs wearing uniform dance costume, posing on one foot with index finger raised and other hand on hip, in Harris studio
